#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Pick Runner Beans
#Text=Runner beans , also known as string beans , are long , slender bean pods that are popular in many vegetable gardens .
#Text=Throughout the growing season , runner beans will ripen and be ready for you to eat .
#Text=With simple harvesting techniques and kitchen prep , you can enjoy fresh vegetables at any time !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Harvesting Your Beans
#Text=Start picking your beans in the middle of summer .
#Text=Beans planted in the spring can be harvested in the later summer months , typically August and September in the Northern hemisphere .
#Text=Keep track of when you planted your beans to determine the best time to start your harvest .
#Text=Runner beans take about 3 months to fully develop from seeds .
#Text=Harvest the pods when they are long .
#Text=Look for bean pods that still have a smooth texture .
#Text=If you can see the beans through the outer pod , the beans are past their prime and may have a tough , stringy texture when you eat them .
#Text=Larger bean pods may look impressive , but they ’ll have a rougher and less desirable texture .
#Text=Pull the bean pod off the stems by hand .
#Text=Grab the bean where it connects to the stem with your thumb and index finger .
#Text=Hold the stem with your other hand and gently pull the bean off .
#Text=Keep the beans you pick in a bag or bucket so you do n’t have to carry them .
#Text=Check your plant every 2 days for ripe beans .
#Text=Runner beans can grow quickly and they will grow multiple times throughout the growing season .
#Text=Keep checking your plant until the first frost .
#Text=If you have too many beans , ask your neighbors to see if they want to pick any for themselves .
#Text=Leave some of the pods on your plant to dry .
#Text=Let the seed pods turn a pale straw-color until early autumn .
#Text=Once the seeds rattle inside the pods , remove them from the plants and bring them inside .
#Text=Remove the beans from the pods and let them dry on a tray until they feel light and hollow .
#Text=Store the beans in mason jars in a cool , dark place .
#Text=When you want to eat the beans , soak them in cool water for 8 hours before you cook them .
#Text=Storing Runner Beans
#Text=Separate the good beans from bad beans .
#Text=Get rid of any beans that are soft to the touch or yellowing .
#Text=Also dispose of any pods where you can see the beans through the skin .
#Text=Only keep beans that are smooth , firm , and a solid green color .
#Text=Keep fresh beans in the fridge for 1 week .
#Text=Put your beans in an airtight container in the vegetable drawer of your refrigerator .
#Text=Make sure they are dry before you store them or else they could develop mold .
#Text=Freeze the beans for up to 1 year .
#Text=Put your beans in a freezer-safe bag and squeeze all the air out from it .
#Text=Seal the bag and use a marker to label them with the date so you know how long you ’ve had them .
#Text=Trimming and Cooking Runner Beans
#Text=Cut the ends off the beans .
#Text=Rinse your beans thoroughly with water and pat them dry .
#Text=Use a chef ’s knife to remove the tips from each side of the bean .
#Text=Cut off and throw away the pieces when you ’re finished .
#Text=Remove the strings from the sides of the beans with a vegetable peeler .
#Text=Hold the bean so the inside edge faces up .
#Text=Start your vegetable peeler on one end of the bean , and pull it down the length of the bean where it looks like there ’s a seam .
#Text=Flip the bean over and remove the string from the other side .
#Text=If you leave the string on , it will be tough to chew when you eat them .
#Text=Fresh runner beans can be stored in the freezer for up to 8 months .
#Text=Cook the beans in boiling water for 3-4 minutes .
#Text=Drop the beans into water over medium heat .
#Text=After 3-4 minutes , the beans should be bright green and tender .
#Text=Use your knife to see if the beans cut apart easily .
#Text=Salt your water before you add the beans so they can absorb the flavor .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Runner beans can be eaten fresh or cooked .
#Text=Check your beanstalks multiple times during the season to get the most out of your harvest .
#Text=Things You ’ll Need
#Text=Bucket or bag
#Text=Chef ’s knife
#Text=Cutting board
#Text=Vegetable peeler
#Text=Stove
#Text=Pot
#Text=Freezer-safe bag
